rules.natural: Either the clinical trial requires FDA approval or the manufacturing facility requires FDA approval.

If the manufacturing process uses unapproved ingredients, then provided that the company following protocols does not result in the company not violating regulations, the company receives a warning from the FDA.
Either the manufacturing process uses unapproved ingredients or the manufacturing process uses incorrect dosages.

If the manufacturing process uses incorrect dosages, then provided that the company following protocols does not result in the company not violating regulations, the company receives a warning from the FDA.
Either the company maintains proper documentation or the company operates legally.
If the company loses records, then the company does not maintain proper documentation.
Either the company loses records or the company falsifies data.
If the company falsifies data, then the company does not maintain proper documentation.
If the facility passes FDA inspection, then the company operates legally.
If the equipment meets GMP standards, then the facility passes FDA inspection.
If the equipment is calibrated properly, then the equipment meets GMP standards.
Either the company has trained staff or the company does not maintain proper documentation.
If the manufacturing facility requires FDA approval, then the company operates legally.
If the staff fails certification, then the company does not have trained staff.
Either the staff fails certification or the staff follows procedures.
If the staff receives insufficient training, then the staff does not follow procedures.
Either the staff receives insufficient training or the staff ignores protocols.
If the staff ignores protocols, then the staff does not follow procedures.
If the marketing application requires FDA approval, then the company operates legally.
Either the clinical trial has completed phase 3 or if the clinical trial requires FDA approval, then the marketing application requires FDA approval.
If the drug batch contains contaminants, then the drug batch fails quality control testing.
Either the drug batch contains contaminants or the company operates legally.
If the drug batch fails quality control testing, then the drug batch gets recalled.
If the company following protocols does not result in the company not violating regulations, then the company does not receive a warning from the FDA.
If the company does not operate legally, then the company violates regulations.

facts.natural: The clinical trial has not completed phase 3.
The drug batch does not get recalled.
